meanings.definition: The state or degree of being feasible.
meanings.sent1: The feasibility of the plan was questioned by the team.
meanings.sent2: The feasibility of building a new bridge was discussed at the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The feasibility of a unicorn parade in the city seemed unlikely.
meanings.sent4: The feasibility of time travel remains a mystery to scientists.
meanings.sent5: The feasibility of flying without wings is purely fictional.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of a project or plan being successful.
meanings.sent1: The feasibility of the new business venture was high.
meanings.sent2: They assessed the feasibility of the marketing campaign before launching it.
meanings.sent3: The feasibility of winning the lottery seemed slim but exciting.
meanings.sent4: The feasibility of reaching the moon was once thought impossible.
meanings.sent5: The feasibility of finding a four-leaf clover is based on luck.

meanings.definition: The practicality or possibility of something happening.
meanings.sent1: The feasibility of fixing the leaky faucet was confirmed by the plumber.
meanings.sent2: They discussed the feasibility of hosting the event outdoors.
meanings.sent3: The feasibility of a penguin becoming a chef made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The feasibility of a snowstorm in summer is highly unlikely.
meanings.sent5: The feasibility of a talking dog is only seen in movies.
